content.description: <math alttext="A g N O 3, aqueous, plus N a B r, aqueous, reacts to produce A g B r, solid, plus N a N O 3, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>AgNO</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mi>Na</mi></mpadded><mi>Br</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mpadded><mi mathvariant="italic">a</mi><mi mathvariant="italic">q</mi></mpadded></mpadded><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><mi>AgBr</mi></mpadded><msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>s</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mi>NaNO</mi></mpadded><mn>3</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math>
content.question: A <math alttext="10.0 milliliter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>10.0</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>mL</mi></math> sample of <math alttext="1.0 molar A g N O 3, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.0</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mi>AgNO</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> and a <math alttext="10.0 milliliter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>10.0</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>mL</mi></math> sample of <math alttext="1.0 molar N a B r, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.0</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>NaBr</mi><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></math>, both originally at <math alttext="25 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>25</mn><mo>°</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>, are combined in a constant-pressure calorimeter where the reaction represented above occurs. If the final temperature of the mixture is <math alttext="35 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>35</mn><mo>°</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>, what is the value of <math alttext="delta H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>H</mi></math> for the reaction? (Assume that the heat absorbed by the calorimeter is negligible, that the total mass of the mixture is <math alttext="20.0 grams" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>20.0</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi></math>, and that the specific heat capacity of the mixture is <math alttext="4.2 joules per gram degree Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4.2</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi><mo>/</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi><mtext>·</mtext><mo>°</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math>.)

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
